titleStmt.title: J. B. Briscoe et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG8537

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p: To his Excelency Gov of Kentucky

The undesigned the Jury in the case of the commonwealth vs. Michael Fishback William Fishback & John Fishback who was tryed on the 5th day of July last for a breach of the peace committed on one George Miller on the hearing of the cause we fined them thirty $30 -- and costs, each, we would most respectfuly ask your honour to remit the fine assessed against William & John Fishback as they are both under age and there Father is a poor man with a large family of children and poorly able to pay said fine we would also ask you to remit a part of the fine assessed against Michael Fishback -- for which your petitioners will ever pray Oct. 10th 1862

J, B, Briscoe } Magistrate
A, G Watts -- Foreman
Thomas W Miller
M W Parrish
J, W, Kean
George Vansenhaller
J. E. Connelly
J. B. Leatherman
J Nunamaker
Isaac McHatter
T D Hall
R D Davis

Pettn to remit fines
(Read not granted)
